li.a: Gua de Recursos para la Comunidad

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif

a.span: Food & Family Resources in the Community during COVID-19 Closure

div.span: If you find yourself in desperate need of basic supplies or some basic food items, call the D.N.A. Hotline # 614-368-6208 and schedule a delivery date. The D.N.A. Hotline is staffed by D.N.A. from 10:00-6:00.

p.style: color: #272727; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 12px; background-color: #ffffff; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt
p.span: Crisis Hotline Madison County:Crisis Hotline Union County: Crisis Text Line for Ohio:

p.style: color: #272727; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 12px; background-color: #ffffff; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small
p.span: Visit our
for a full list of resources and support organizations in our area.

br.span: Contact JA Student Support Specialist JoLynn Wheatley at

span.span: [emailprotected]

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif

p.span: Good afternoon,

We hope everyone is doing well as we wrap up our first full week of remote learning. This email is to further explain Mr. Chapmans phone call and the Chromebook device pick-up next week. Again, wed like to thank our Jonathan Alder Board of Education for their support in making student accessibility a priority.

We are offering to lend one district-owned Chromebook to each family for student educational purposes. If your children already have plenty of access to devices, please consider deferring this offer so that we can meet as many district needs as possible.

span.strong: There will be a drive-thru pick-up at the High School for all families on:

p.span: If you are unable to pick up during these times, email [emailprotected] with subject line Device Needed. Include your name, your childs name, and a phone number and time to best reach you in the email.
Please see the Device Loan Agreement & Chromebook Care Guidelines.

span.br: Reminder: Free Grab-and-Go Meals are available for ALL students at Monroe Elementary and Plain City Elementary from 11:00-1:00 on school days. Meals will be served Monday-Thursday next week. School will not be in session next Friday, April 10.

p.span: Enjoy the sunshine this weekend! #PioneersPressOn

span.br: We understand students and families will have different feelings and needs as a result of the events transpiring. Please visit our website for community information including a crisis hotline, counseling resources, food and other services. Please do not hesitate to contact your school with questions or for more information.

span.span: Share your posts/photos with our JA Community on Social Media

p.span:
For the most up-to-date information about COVID-19, please refer to our Health Departments:
Madison County Public Healths website
Union County Health Departments website
Ohio Department of Healths website
CDC website

p.style: text-align: center
p.span:
Message from Jonathan Alder Local School District
www.alder.k12.oh.us

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span: Good afternoon,

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span: Governor DeWine announced in his press conference today that all Ohio Schools will remain physically closed through May 1st. All Jonathan Alder schools will continue to implement remote learning for students as planned. Assuming grace and flexibility, our goal is to maintain connection with our students and each of you while providing consistency, structure and educational purpose.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span: In light of the Governors announcement, we will communicate any changes to our schedules, planned events and activities as soon as possible.In compliance with the state health order, all JA athletic facilities and playgrounds will remain closed until further notice. We also strongly discourage gathering in groups and organized play and ask that you adhere to physical distancing at all times. Thank you for your cooperation.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span: Reminder:FreeGrab-and-Go Mealsare available from 11:00 am-1:00 pm for ALL students Monday-Friday at Monroe Elementary School and Plain City Elementary School.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span: Again, your flexibility and support is gratefully appreciated. Thank you for taking care of each other during these challenging times. Stay positive, Pioneers. And Press On.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span: Respectfully,

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span:
Gary Chapman
Superintendent

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif

span.br: We understand students and families will have different feelings and needs as a result of the events transpiring.Visitour websitefor community information regarding counseling resources, food and other services. Please do not hesitate to contact your school with questions or for more information.

span.strong: Share your posts/photos with our JA Community on Social Media#PioneerPressOn #japioneerpride

br.span: For the most up-to-date information about COVID-19, please refer to our Health Departments:

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-align: center
p.span:
MessagefromJonathanAlderLocal School District
www.alder.k12.oh.us

span.em: Grab-and-Go Meals available and Remote Learning begins tomorrow, Wednesday, March 18!

br.span: Please refer to your classroom teacher and building principal communications for details and let them know if you have any questions. We appreciate your patience and support as we embark on this learning journey together. We will work to mitigate issues as quickly as possible when they arise. We are looking forward to engaging with our students!

span.em: Numerous providers are offering limited time free internet access. Check with your local providers for details.

br.span: Waivers were acquired by the State for schools to serve meals during school closures as and if they are able and apply for the appropriate meal program. Jonathan Alder Food Services has taken the appropriate steps and at this time will be serving Grab-and-Go Meals (lunch and breakfast for the next day) from 11:00 am-1:00 pm on the following days:

p.span: Wednesday, March 18 - Friday, March 20

strong.em: These meals are FREE of charge and available to ALL students K-12 who attend Jonathan Alder Local Schools.
Pick-up locations at this time will be the parking lots of Plain City Elementary and Monroe Elementary on the above days, again from 11:00 am-1:00 pm.

span.em: Please pick-up meals daily from whichever location is most convenient for your family.

p.span: Message from Rebecca Rings, Food Services Director:

span.em: If you have any questions, please let me know

. I understand that this is all new to everyone and we are trying to stay as flexible while maintaining the integrity of the Food Service Program within the guidelines set forth by ODE and USDA. As more information becomes available, it will be shared with you.

br.span: We understand students and families will have different feelings about the events transpiring.

a.span: Here is a list of counseling resources

br.span: . This is on our website under the Community tab along with our Community Resource Guide. Please do not hesitate to contact your school with questions or for more information, as needed.
Please make arrangements to pick-up student medications that are typically kept at school as soon as possible. These must be picked up by a parent/guardian.

span.strong: Share your posts/photos with our JA Community on Social Media#PioneersPressOn #japioneerpride

p.span: For the most up-to-date information about COVID-19, please refer to our Health Departments:

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-align: center
p.span: MessagefromJonathanAlderLo
cal School District

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small

span.span: Parents and Guardians,

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small

span.span: We are sharing this information as we continue to develop and update our plans for school closures. We understand the difficulties and significant impact this will have and hope these details will help your families plan and prepare for the weeks ahead. We will continue to communicate additional details as they are available.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small

span.span: Beginning Monday, March 16, Jonathan Alder Local Schools will be closed for all students.Our staff will take two days (Monday and Tuesday) to prepare appropriate educational opportunities and remote student learning will commence next Wednesday, March 18. We will still have Spring Break March 23-27. Remote learning will resume Monday, March 30.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small

span.span: Remote Learning Plans
Will be accessible to provide services and resources remotely.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small

span.span: Communication about remote learning will be sent from classroom teachers and/or principals.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small

span.span: Grades K-4 will utilize Clever as the instructional portal for the delivery of instructional materials and activities. Look for information sent from classroom teachers and building principals.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small

span.span: Grade-level teams at each elementary school will provide daily lessons that meet the objective of maintaining skills and a grade-level teacher will be available for at least 1 hour a day for learning support through a teleconference system. Grade level teams will compile a teacher page for digital resources. Teachers will change topics and resources weekly to support their instructional plans.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small

span.span: Related arts teachers will provide PE/Art/Music/Guidance lessons on a rotation schedule determined at the building level.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small

span.span: Grades 5-12 will utilize Canvas for the delivery of asynchronous instructional material. Look for information sent from building principals.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small

span.span: Teachers in grades 5-12 will provide daily lessons that meet the objective of maintaining skills and each teacher will be available for at least 1 hour a day for learning support through a teleconference system or synchronous discussion board.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small

span.span: Student Meals

Waivers were acquired by the State for schools to serve meals during school closures as and if they are able and apply for the appropriate meal program. Jonathan Alder Food Services has taken the appropriate steps and at this time will be servingGrab-and-Go Meals(lunch and breakfast for the next day) from 11:00 am-1:00 pm on the following days:

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small

span.span: Wednesday, March 18 - Friday, March 20
Monday, March 30 - Friday, April 3

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small

span.span: These meals are FREE of charge and available to ALL students K-12 who attend Jonathan Alder Local Schools. You will only need student IDs (the same numbers students use during school lunchtime) to pick-up meals.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small

span.span: Pick-up locations at this time will be the parking lots of Plain City Elementary and Monroe Elementary on the above days, again from 11:00 am-1:00 pm. Please pick-up meals daily from whichever location is most convenient for your family.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small

span.span: Message from Rebecca Rings, Food Services Director:

span.em: If you have any questions, please let me know

. I understand that this is all new to everyone and we are trying to stay flexible while maintaining the integrity of the Food Service Program within the guidelines set forth by ODE and USDA. As more information becomes available, it will be shared with you.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small

span.span: Counseling Resources for Families
We understand students and families will have different feelings about the events transpiring.
span.a: Here is a list of counseling resources
span.span: . This is on our website under the
tab along with our Community Resource Guide. Please do not hesitate to contact your school with questions or for more information, as needed.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small

br.span: Please make arrangements to pick-up student medications that are typically kept at school as soon as possible. These must be picked up by a parent/guardian.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small

span.span: For the most up-to-date information about COVID-19, please refer to our Health Departments:

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; text-align: center
p.span: MessagefromJonathanAlderLocal School District

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span: Parents and Guardians,

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span: School will be in session tomorrow, Friday, March 13. As we said yesterday, this is a rapidly changing situation and since then we have received further guidance from our Health Departments and the Governors Office. In the interest of preserving public health, effective Monday, March 16, Jonathan Alder Local Schools will be closed for all students.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span: You will receive detailed information via this message system and our website about how to access remote learning opportunities. Our staff will take two business days (Monday and Tuesday) to prepare appropriate educational opportunities and remote student learning will commence next Wednesday, March 18. We will still have Spring Break March 23-27. Remote learning will resume Monday, March 30.

ul.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif

p.span: All athletics, music, PTO, Booster, class field trips, extra and co-curricular trips, activities and events are canceled until further notice.
Weight training, conditioning, open gyms or anything of that nature is also prohibited.
No visitors will be permitted beyond the office beginning tomorrow, Friday, March 13.
All staff travel for professional development is canceled.
We are discontinuing rental and use of our facilities by outside entities until further notice.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span: We understand the difficulties and significant impact this will have on all of our families and we truly appreciate your cooperation and support. We all play an important role in mitigating the spread of this disease and we will send further communication as health department guidance evolves.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span: Respectfully,

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span:
Gary Chapman
Superintendent

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span: For the most up-to-date information about COVID-19, please refer to our Health Departments:

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-align: center
p.span:
MessagefromJonathanAlderLocal School District
www.alder.k12.oh.us

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span: Parents and Guardians,

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span: The health and safety of our students and staff is, and always will be, our top priority. We are sending this letter as an update about COVID-19 coronavirus and our efforts to ensure the health and safety of all of our students and staff. This afternoon, Ohio Governor Mike DeWine confirmed that there are 4 cases of COVID-19 in Ohio, however, he and the Ohio Department of Health are not recommending closing schools at this time.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span: While these cases are not located in our county, we are continuing to work in earnest to reduce the potential spread of germs. The district is taking steps to minimize exposure and prepare for a potential district closure by following guidelines provided by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), Madison County Public Health, Union County Health Department and the Ohio Department of Health.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span: This is a global health event that impacts us all. It requires us to take careful precautions and to follow the advice provided by public health experts.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif

span.strong: How is the district preventing the spread of disease on school grounds?
span.br: All buildings are cleaned and disinfected regularly with hospital-grade disinfectants as a standard practice. Out of an abundance of caution, buildings have been and will be cleaned and disinfected more often. Our cleaning procedures include our buses and technology devices.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif

span.strong: What can staff and students do to stay healthy?
span.br: Please follow all health guidelines provided by the CDC, such as hand washing, covering a cough or sneeze with a tissue, avoid touching your face, and staying home when you are sick except to receive medical care. If any student/staff member appears to be symptomatic, we will remove him/her from the general population and contact the health department.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif

span.br: The health and safety of our students and staff is our top priority. We are working closely with local health officials to determine the best course of action. If it is determined that schools need to be closed, we will give families detailed information. At this time, we encourage parents to begin identifying childcare accommodations in the event schools are closed.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif

span.strong: Will my childs attendance be excused if he/she misses school?
span.br: At this time, we have received no communication from the Ohio Department of Education or the State instructing us to legally change or modify attendance policies.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif

span.strong: If schools are closed, what is our remote education plan?
span.br: We have plans in place to continue our educational mission; however, the health of our staff and students is whats most important. If someone is symptomatic or has contracted COVID-19, their focus should be on getting better. For all non-infected students and staff, we will utilize online resources as appropriate to provide educational opportunities.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif

span.strong: Are there any district/school event cancellations at this time?
span.br: There are no district-related cancellations at this time; however, this is a rapidly changing situation. Right now, we ask all families to proceed with an abundance of caution, especially as we enter spring break (CDC Travel Advisory Page).

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span: The new public health recommendation is for people at high risk (older adults and people who have serious chronic medical conditions and compromised immune systems) to stay home and away from large groups of people as much as possible. For people who are not high risk, please take normal communicable disease precautions.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
p.span: We will continue to provide information as this situation develops. For up-to-date information, please refer to our Health Departments:

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif
caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-align: center
p.span:
MessagefromJonathanAlderLocal School District
www.alder.k12.oh.us

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; margin-left: 6pt
caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; margin-left: 6pt
p.span: Parents and Guardians,

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; margin-left: 5.95pt
p.span: We are sharing this letter to provide you with an update about coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and Jonathan Alders efforts to ensure the health and safety of all students in our buildings.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; margin-left: 5.95pt
p.span: Although cases ofCOVID-19continue to be detected in the United States the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention still considers the risk to the general American public to be low at this time. As of March 5, there are currently no confirmed cases ofCOVID-19in Ohio.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; margin-left: 6pt
p.span: We are working closely with Madison County Public Health, Union County Health Department and Columbus Public Health to monitor the situation and develop a coordinated and comprehensive public health plan to ensure we are prepared if cases arise in our community. Our district will be prepared to implement public health recommendations as required. Updated information will be shared as it becomes available.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; margin-left: 6pt
p.span: As we head towards spring break, we know travel may be planned. There is community spread ofCOVID-19in other countries and areas of the U.S. It is recommended that you check the
page prior to your travels.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; margin-left: 6pt
p.span: In Ohio, we continue to be in the peak of flu season. Columbus Public Health recommends that individuals receive the flu vaccination and engage in everyday, preventive measures to prevent the spread of germs and avoid illness, such as:

ul.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif

li.span: Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth.
Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, then throw the tissue in the trash.
Stay home when you are sick, except to get medical care.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.

p.style: caret-color: #222222; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; margin-left: 5.95pt
p.span: These prevention measures will also be our best line of defense if the time comes that we do seeCOVID-19in our community. Additional information aboutCOVID-19is available onMadison County Public Healths website,Union County Health Departments websiteand the

div.span: 2020. All Rights Reserved. Jonathan Alder Local School District
